body:
Comment 5: 
I'm running 3.3.0-8 on F16 x86-64 and everything still works there.

Changes in this area:

3.4rc1 http://lwn.net/Articles/490034/
3.4rc2 http://lwn.net/Articles/491171/

http://git.kernel.org/?p=linux%2Fkernel%2Fgit%2Ftorvalds%2Flinux.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=vDSO

http://git.kernel.org/?p=linux%2Fkernel%2Fgit%2Ftorvalds%2Flinux.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=vsyscall

But according to Koji, the latest kernel for F17 is 3.3.2-1:

http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/packageinfo?packageID=8

I doubt anything this major would have changed between 3.3.0-8 and 3.3.2-1.

See changelog in http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=313109

Maybe the virtual machine part of this setup is causing problems? As another data point,
we've been testing our Go code in a QEMU/KVM VM with F16 x86-64 3.3.0-8 as host and
guest without problems.
